Pong, released by Atari in 1972, is one of the first commercially successful video games and a cornerstone of gaming history. The game simulates table tennis, with each player controlling a vertical paddle to bounce a ball back and forth across the screen. Its simple design and intuitive mechanics made it accessible to everyone, while its competitive gameplay captivated players and helped popularize arcade gaming. Pong’s success paved the way for the modern video game industry and remains a classic example of how simplicity can create lasting impact.
